result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark T. Haka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
With Huber and Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:55 am case called. Defendant Mark T. Haka in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on record. State moves to amend Count 1 to Misd. Possession of THC. in violation of 961.41(3g)(e).   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Court accepts the amendment as stated by ADA Anderson to Count 1.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 & No Contest to Count 2.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Count 1-60 days WCJ with Huber and Good Time Credit. To begin service no later than July 8, 2016. Credit for 1 days served. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. COUNT 2- 30 days WCJ with Huber and Good Time Credit, concurrent to Count 1. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2016 at 11:15 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ulrich states P/S.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Status conference on April 19, 2016 at 10:20 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich in court, appearing via telephone  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  STC adjourned as requested.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 10:20 am.

Case called @ 2:19 p.m. Defendant Mark T. Haka in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed by ADA Anderson. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 09:20 am.
Defendant and Atty Szilagyi appear via video from the WC Jail.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:11 p.m. Defendant Mark T. Haka in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. DE will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $2500 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Szilagyi. Court orders $2500 Sig Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
